intro: Cochlearia sisymbroides, commonly known as the narrowleaf mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and delicate white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
